text: 1. A certain coin comes up Heads with an unknown probability p each time it is tossed. It is tossed 6 times, giving 5 Heads. (a) Find an unbiased estimate for p, giving your reasoning. (b) Assuming the coin is fair (p = 1/2), what is the probability that the number of Heads is not in the range {2,3,4}? (Â¢) Do the data provide grounds to reject the hypothesis that the coin is fair with 90% confidence?
